inputs.materialNarrative: Moderately conductive, somewhat malleable when heated. The workhorse of civilization - reliable, abundant, essential for weapons, tools, and armor.
Refined oak planks with improved durability and quality.

input.narrative: The foundational smithing technique - blade, tang, handle. Simple in concept, demanding in execution. Every smith remembers their first sword.

metadata.narrative: A simple iron blade with a wooden handle. Every warrior's first step on the path to mastery. The weight feels right in your hand - not perfect, but yours.

inputs.materialNarrative: Refined copper shaped into usable ingots. Malleable, forgiving for beginner crafters, accepts enchantments readily.
Reliable, sturdy timber from ancient oaks. Dense grain, strong fibers, and a warm golden-brown hue. The standard by which all other woods are measured.

input.narrative: Your first pickaxe. The gateway to greater resources and deeper discoveries.

metadata.narrative: Basic copper pickaxe with a wooden handle. Your first step into the mining profession - crude but functional.

inputs.materialNarrative: Refined copper shaped into usable ingots. Malleable, forgiving for beginner crafters, accepts enchantments readily.
Light, flexible wood harvested from tall conifers. Works easily under a blade, bends without breaking.

input.narrative: Basic axe for woodcutting. Simple but essential for any aspiring adventurer.

metadata.narrative: Simple copper axe with oak handle. Every woodcutter's first companion on the journey to mastery.

inputs.materialNarrative: Pale wood with excellent shock absorption. Weapon handles made from ash feel alive in your grip.
Refined copper shaped into usable ingots. Malleable, forgiving for beginner crafters, accepts enchantments readily.

input.narrative: Simple spear with copper tip. Keep your enemies at a distance.

metadata.narrative: Simple copper-tipped spear with ash wood shaft. The extra reach keeps danger at arm's length. Perfect for those who prefer distance over direct confrontation.

inputs.materialNarrative: Translucent gelatinous substance. Surprisingly elastic and adhesive when processed.
Rough grey pelt from common wolves. Durable but coarse, requires treatment to soften.

input.narrative: Basic leather protection. Better than nothing, lighter than metal.

metadata.narrative: Basic leather protection stitched from wolf pelts and bound with slime gel. Better than nothing, lighter than metal, and it might just save your life.

inputs.materialNarrative: Moderately conductive, somewhat malleable when heated. The workhorse of civilization - reliable, abundant, essential for weapons, tools, and armor.
Rough grey pelt from common wolves. Durable but coarse, requires treatment to soften.

input.narrative: Reinforced leather boots with iron caps. Protects your feet without slowing you down.

metadata.narrative: Reinforced leather boots with iron caps. Protects your feet without slowing you down. Essential for anyone who values both mobility and survival.

inputs.materialNarrative: Refined ash planks with superior shock absorption properties.
Moderately conductive, somewhat malleable when heated. The workhorse of civilization - reliable, abundant, essential for weapons, tools, and armor.

input.narrative: Upgraded pickaxe that can tackle tougher deposits. Iron reliability meets practical design.

metadata.narrative: Reliable iron pickaxe. Durable enough to tackle tougher deposits and efficient for standard mining work.

inputs.materialNarrative: Refined birch planks, perfect for detailed craftwork.
Moderately conductive, somewhat malleable when heated. The workhorse of civilization - reliable, abundant, essential for weapons, tools, and armor.

input.narrative: Solid iron axe for serious forestry work. Bites deep and true.

metadata.narrative: Sturdy iron axe that bites deep into wood. The standard tool for serious forestry work.

inputs.materialNarrative: Razor-sharp fang from alpha predators. Still warm from the kill.
Refined maple planks, ideal for items requiring stability.
Superior to iron in every way. Holds a keen edge, resists corrosion, and strikes with authority.

input.narrative: Balanced steel longsword. The blade flows like water, strikes like thunder.

metadata.narrative: Balanced steel longsword that flows like water and strikes like thunder. The blade sings when it cuts through air, a testament to its quality.

inputs.materialNarrative: Iridescent shell segment. Lightweight yet remarkably impact-resistant.
Moderately conductive, somewhat malleable when heated. The workhorse of civilization - reliable, abundant, essential for weapons, tools, and armor.
Rough grey pelt from common wolves. Durable but coarse, requires treatment to soften.

input.narrative: Iron plates protect vital organs. Heavy but reliable.

metadata.narrative: Iron plates protecting vital organs with beetle carapace reinforcement. Heavy but reliable. When arrows fly and blades swing, you'll appreciate every ounce of protection.

inputs.materialNarrative: Superior to iron in every way. Holds a keen edge, resists corrosion, and strikes with authority.
Rough grey pelt from common wolves. Durable but coarse, requires treatment to soften.

input.narrative: Steel helm with full face protection. Your head stays attached, which is nice.

metadata.narrative: Steel helm with full face protection and wolf pelt padding. Your head stays attached, which is nice. The padding reduces the ringing when you take a hit.

inputs.materialNarrative: Refined ironwood planks, nearly as strong as actual metal.

input.narrative: Steel pickaxe with perfect balance. Makes hard rock feel like clay.

metadata.narrative: Steel pickaxe with perfect balance. Bites into hard rock with confidence.

inputs.materialNarrative: Refined ironwood planks, nearly as strong as actual metal.
Superior to iron in every way. Holds a keen edge, resists corrosion, and strikes with authority.

input.narrative: Razor-edged steel axe. Ancient trees fall before it.

metadata.narrative: Well-balanced steel axe with a razor edge. Fells even ancient trees with steady, powerful strikes.

inputs.materialNarrative: Refined ebony planks, perfect for anti-magic applications.
Crystallized blood from elemental beasts. Pulses with residual power.
Refined mithril that whispers of ancient secrets. Perfect for weapons that need both power and grace.

input.narrative: Mithril dagger that seems to shimmer out of existence. Wickedly sharp, impossibly light.

metadata.narrative: Mithril dagger that seems to shimmer out of existence. Wickedly sharp and impossibly light, it strikes faster than the eye can follow. The blade whispers through air and flesh alike.

inputs.materialNarrative: Refined ebony planks, perfect for anti-magic applications.
Refined mithril that whispers of ancient secrets. Perfect for weapons that need both power and grace.

input.narrative: Legendary mithril pickaxe that sings through stone. Impossibly light yet incredibly effective.

metadata.narrative: Legendary mithril pickaxe that sings through stone. Impossibly light yet incredibly effective.

inputs.materialNarrative: Refined ebony planks, perfect for anti-magic applications.
Petrified remains from ancient guardians. Contains geological memories.
Refined mithril that whispers of ancient secrets. Perfect for weapons that need both power and grace.

input.narrative: Ethereal mithril axe that phases through wood fibers. Cuts with minimal resistance.

metadata.narrative: Ethereal mithril axe that seems to phase through wood fibers. Cuts with minimal resistance.

inputs.materialNarrative: Refined copper shaped into usable ingots. Malleable, forgiving for beginner crafters, accepts enchantments readily.
Orange-red crystal pulsing with trapped flames. Warm to touch, occasionally sparks.

input.narrative: Simple copper band with fire crystal. Radiates gentle warmth.

metadata.narrative: Simple copper band holding a fire crystal. Radiates gentle warmth against your skin. The crystal pulses with contained flames, never dimming, never burning.

inputs.materialNarrative: Moderately conductive, somewhat malleable when heated. The workhorse of civilization - reliable, abundant, essential for weapons, tools, and armor.
Blue crystal filled with flowing liquid. Cool and calming, perpetually damp.

input.narrative: Iron amulet holding a water crystal. Feels cool against your skin.

metadata.narrative: Iron amulet cradling water crystals. Feels cool against your skin, like a gentle stream running across your chest. The crystals shimmer with captured tides.

inputs.materialNarrative: Crackling crystal surrounded by static discharge. Handle with insulated gloves.
Ethereal substance from creatures between worlds. Exists partially out of phase.
Superior to iron in every way. Holds a keen edge, resists corrosion, and strikes with authority.

input.narrative: Steel bracelet with lightning shard. Crackles with stored static.

metadata.narrative: Steel bracelet woven with lightning shards and spectral thread. Crackles with stored static electricity. Touch it and feel the power humming beneath the surface.

inputs.materialNarrative: Speckled igneous rock with visible crystalline structure. Harder than limestone, more reliable for load-bearing structures.
Moderately conductive, somewhat malleable when heated. The workhorse of civilization - reliable, abundant, essential for weapons, tools, and armor.

input.narrative: Basic stone forge suitable for working copper and iron. The foundation of smithing.

metadata.narrative: Basic stone forge suitable for working copper and iron. The foundation of smithing - crude but functional. Every master started with a forge like this.

inputs.materialNarrative: Dense metamorphic rock with distinctive banding. Exceptional compression strength.
Orange-red crystal pulsing with trapped flames. Warm to touch, occasionally sparks.
Superior to iron in every way. Holds a keen edge, resists corrosion, and strikes with authority.

input.narrative: Improved forge with better heat retention. Can work steel reliably.

metadata.narrative: Improved forge with better heat retention and basalt construction. Can work steel reliably. Fire crystals enhance the heat, pushing temperatures higher.

inputs.materialNarrative: Refined mithril that whispers of ancient secrets. Perfect for weapons that need both power and grace.
Volcanic glass born in the heart of eruptions. Extremely sharp edges, incredibly brittle structure.
Ash-grey substance from legendary phoenix nests. Burns eternally without being consumed.
Captured lightning from primordial storms. Contains raw creation energy.

input.narrative: Master forge with crystal enhancement. Can reach extreme temperatures.

metadata.narrative: Master forge with obsidian construction and crystal enhancement. Can reach extreme temperatures needed for legendary metals. Phoenix ash ensures the flames never die.

inputs.materialNarrative: Refined copper shaped into usable ingots. Malleable, forgiving for beginner crafters, accepts enchantments readily.
Common sedimentary rock. Soft enough to carve with basic tools yet strong enough for simple construction.

input.narrative: Basic refinery for turning raw ores into usable ingots. Essential for any metalworker.

metadata.narrative: Basic limestone refinery for turning raw ores into usable ingots. Essential for any metalworker. The crucible glows red-hot as impurities burn away.

inputs.materialNarrative: Green-brown crystal with swirling sediment. Surprisingly heavy, grounds magical energies.
Speckled igneous rock with visible crystalline structure. Harder than limestone, more reliable for load-bearing structures.

input.narrative: Advanced refinery with better efficiency and heat control.

metadata.narrative: Advanced refinery with improved efficiency and heat control. Can process higher-grade ores and create complex alloys. The granite construction handles intense heat without cracking.

inputs.materialNarrative: Pale crystal that drifts upward if not secured. Contains compressed winds.
Refined pine planks, perfect for bows and flexible constructions.
Translucent gelatinous substance. Surprisingly elastic and adhesive when processed.

input.narrative: Simple pine bow strung with treated sinew. Not powerful, but reliable.

metadata.narrative: Simple pine shortbow strung with treated slime gel. Not powerful, but reliable and easy to maintain. Perfect for learning the basics of archery.

inputs.materialNarrative: Speckled igneous rock with visible crystalline structure. Harder than limestone, more reliable for load-bearing structures.
Refined oak planks with improved durability and quality.
Blue crystal filled with flowing liquid. Cool and calming, perpetually damp.

input.narrative: Basic alchemy table with mortar, pestle, and glassware.

metadata.narrative: Wooden workbench fitted with glass vials, copper cauldrons, and measuring instruments. This is where plants become potions and careful mixing creates powerful effects.

inputs.materialNarrative: Iridescent shell segment. Lightweight yet remarkably impact-resistant.
Refined birch planks, perfect for detailed craftwork.
Moderately conductive, somewhat malleable when heated. The workhorse of civilization - reliable, abundant, essential for weapons, tools, and armor.

input.narrative: Basic workbench for assembling mechanical devices.

metadata.narrative: Sturdy iron workbench equipped with precision tools, vises, and gear assemblies. Here mechanisms take shape - springs tension, gears mesh, devices come to life.

inputs.materialNarrative: Razor-sharp fang from alpha predators. Still warm from the kill.
Refined ironwood planks, nearly as strong as actual metal.
Superior to iron in every way. Holds a keen edge, resists corrosion, and strikes with authority.

input.narrative: Forging a steel battleaxe requires balance - too heavy and it's unwieldy, too light and it lacks impact. This versatile weapon can devastate with two hands or still threaten with one.

metadata.narrative: Steel battleaxe with brutal cleaving power. Grip it with both hands and watch enemies fall like timber. Equally deadly in one hand for those strong enough to wield it.

inputs.materialNarrative: Speckled igneous rock with visible crystalline structure. Harder than limestone, more reliable for load-bearing structures.
Moderately conductive, somewhat malleable when heated. The workhorse of civilization - reliable, abundant, essential for weapons, tools, and armor.
Refined oak planks with improved durability and quality.

input.narrative: Crafting a warhammer is about managing weight distribution. The crushing head must be perfectly balanced on the shaft, or it becomes a liability rather than a weapon.

metadata.narrative: Heavy iron warhammer that crushes armor and bone alike. The weight demands both hands, but the devastation it delivers makes that trade worthwhile. Favored by those who prefer decisive, crushing blows.

inputs.materialNarrative: Refined copper shaped into usable ingots. Malleable, forgiving for beginner crafters, accepts enchantments readily.
Rough grey pelt from common wolves. Durable but coarse, requires treatment to soften.

input.narrative: A dagger is deceptively simple - just a blade and a grip. But the balance must be perfect for quick, precise strikes.

metadata.narrative: Simple copper dagger, light and quick. Not much reach, but what it lacks in power it makes up for in speed. Perfect for those who value precision over brute force.

inputs.materialNarrative: Refined ash planks with superior shock absorption properties.
Translucent gelatinous substance. Surprisingly elastic and adhesive when processed.
Ethereal substance from creatures between worlds. Exists partially out of phase.

input.narrative: Crafting a composite bow requires laminating different materials - wood for flexibility, sinew for power, silk for the string. Patience yields deadly accuracy.

metadata.narrative: Composite longbow of ash wood and sinew, strung with silk-spider thread. The draw is heavy, demanding both hands and steady arms, but arrows fly true and far. Distance is your advantage.
